assessments.issue: Markdown to HTML conversion not working when n8n sends markdown via POST API - description_html ends up with markdown text wrapped in editor paragraph tags instead of proper HTML
assessments.action: Fixed the issue in apps/api/plane/utils/html_processor.py by: (1) Updated is_markdown_content() to recognize hybrid content where some formatting is already HTML (e.g., <strong>, <em>) but other markdown syntax remains raw (e.g., # headings). Added 'strong', 'b', 'em', 'i', 'br' to acceptable_tags so that presence of these tags doesn't prevent markdown detection. (2) Updated process_description_html() to handle hybrid content by first converting existing HTML to markdown (preserving formatting like bold/italic as **text** and *text*), then converting the unified markdown back to proper HTML. This ensures that both raw markdown syntax (headings, lists) and already-converted HTML formatting (bold, italic) are properly processed.

summary: Reverted the markdown library version to 3.7 as requested. Fixed the markdown-to-HTML conversion issue for API requests by improving the markdown detection to handle hybrid content (mix of raw markdown and already-converted HTML), and updating the processing logic to normalize everything through markdown first before final HTML conversion.
